unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post on "Urban Gym Culture" in the "Lifestyle & Wellness" category:
normalised: What is your take on the urban gym culture in India? Is it really worth the hype?

unnormalised: **What's your take on the urban gym culture in India? Is it really worth the hype?**
normalised: Hey guys! So, I have been seeing this whole explosion of gym culture, especially here in Mumbai, and I am curious to hear everyone's thoughts. Back in the day, it was just akhadas and maybe the occasional Y M C A. Now, every corner has a fancy gym with treadmills costing more than my dad's old Maruti eight hundred!

unnormalised: Hey guys! So, I've been seeing this whole explosion of gym culture, especially here in Mumbai, and I'm curious to hear everyone's thoughts. Back in the day, it was just akhadas and maybe the occasional YMCA. Now, every corner has a fancy gym with treadmills costing more than my dad's old Maruti 800!
normalised: It feels like half of my Instagram feed is now protein shakes, hash gym life selfies, and people chasing that "perfect" Bollywood body (Remember the madness after John Abraham in Dhoom? Still going strong!). Don't get me wrong, prioritizing fitness is fantastic. But is this obsession healthy? Are we focusing too much on aesthetics and less on actual well-being?

unnormalised: It feels like half of my Instagram feed is now protein shakes, #gymlife selfies, and people chasing that "perfect" Bollywood body (Remember the madness after John Abraham in Dhoom? Still going strong!). Don't get me wrong, prioritizing fitness is fantastic. But is this obsession healthy? Are we focusing too much on aesthetics and less on actual well-being?
normalised: I have seen friends skipping family dinners during Diwali to make sure they get their workout in, and colleagues bragging about their "macros" like it is some sort of secret I I T-J E E code.

unnormalised: I've seen friends skipping family dinners during Diwali to make sure they get their workout in, and colleagues bragging about their "macros" like it's some sort of secret IIT-JEE code.
normalised: Are we actually getting healthier, or just more obsessed with looking a certain way? What is the balance we should be aiming for? Maybe a brisk walk near Marine Drive is just as beneficial as that five A M gym session... Thoughts? Also, any tips on finding a good gym that is not all about the show and more about actual fitness? Rupees twenty thousand a month seems a bit steep for just using a treadmill for thirty minutes, right?

unnormalised: Are we actually getting healthier, or just more obsessed with looking a certain way? What's the balance we should be aiming for? Maybe a brisk walk near Marine Drive is just as beneficial as that 5 AM gym session... Thoughts? Also, any tips on finding a good gym that *isn't* all about the show and more about actual fitness? Rs. 20,000 a month seems a bit steep for just using a treadmill for 30 mins, right?
